text:
“I don’t know that,” Dounia said, her tone dry. “I heard a story. Philip was a hypochondriac. He hanged himself, partly due to Svidrigaïlov’s mockery.”

Luzhin twisted his lips into a smile. “You seem eager to defend him. He’s astute, especially with ladies. Marfa Petrovna’s death was a terrible instance.”

“Pyotr Petrovitch, please,” Dounia interrupted. “Say no more of Svidrigaïlov. It makes me miserable.”

Raskolnikov finally spoke. “He has just been to see me.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia expresses her discomfort with discussions about Mr. Svidrigaïlov, highlighting the negative impact he has on her.
